page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: ...continued. Wentworth Hall had been a private mansion.During the war it became a home for refugees and later a hotel, then it was pulled down and modern town houses replaced it.St.Vincent's Convent was once one of King Charles the Second's many homes.We were told stories of an underground passage leading from the house to the gazeebo. Here,we were assured, Nell Gwyn often stayed;later the gazeebo was called the Temple. The Adam and Eve pub on the Ridgeway has been there for many years.In fact, it is reputed to have sheltered Dick Turpin,the highwayman.
